title: Pavel Durov says Telegram is now profitable - TechCrunch
summary:
Pavel Durov says Telegram is now profitable

Date: Monday, Publication Source: TechCrunch

Telegram founder Pavel Durov announced that the company has become profitable, with total revenue exceeding $1 billion in 2024 and a growing user base.

  • Telegram now has 12 million paid users following its premium subscription launch in 2022.
  • The app reportedly holds over $500 million in cash reserves.
  • Durov mentioned significant debt repayment, indicating a strategy to reduce financial liabilities.
  • Telegram has more than 950 million monthly active users.
  • Future plans include going public and profitability by 2025.
“Over the past four years, Telegram has issued about $2 billion in debt. We repaid a meaningful share of it this Fall, taking advantage of favorable prices for the Telegram bonds. But there’s a lot of work ahead,” Pavel Durov.

The announcement reflects Telegram's successful monetization strategies and potential for future growth.
newTitle: Pavel Durov announces Telegram's profitability and growth

title: Mamata Machinery IPO booked 195 times on Day 3; share allotment tomorrow; here’s how to check status online - Upstox
summary:
Mamata Machinery IPO Surges with 195 Times Subscription on Day 3; Allotment Status Tomorrow

Date: December 24, 2023

Source: Not specified

Mamata Machinery IPO allotment status will be finalized today. Investors can check the status online via NSE, BSE, and Link Intime India.

Key Points

  • The IPO opened for subscription on December 19 and aims to raise ₹179.39 crore.
  • It was subscribed more than 194 times with over 100 crore bids against 51.78 lakh shares available.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) subscribed 235.8 times, while Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) subscribed 274.38 times.
  • The retail portion was booked over 138 times with bids for more than 35.50 crore shares.
  • Refunds will be issued on December 26, and shares will be credited to Demat accounts on the same day.

Notable Quotes

“Mamata Machinery looks forward to enhancing its visibility as well as brand recognition through this IPO.”

Conclusion

The Mamata Machinery IPO showcases robust investor interest, setting the stage for its upcoming share allotment and market debut.
newTitle: Mamata Machinery IPO Surges with 195 Times Subscription on Day 3; Allotment Status Tomorrow

title: Mamata Machinery IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed 194.95 times on third day; GMP signals multibagger listing | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Mamata Machinery IPO Day 3 Updates: Issue Subscribed 194.95 Times

Date: 23 Dec 2024

Source: LiveMint

Mamata Machinery IPO, which opened on Thursday, closed for subscription today with a significant response from investors.

  • The IPO was subscribed 194.95 times overall, with particular strength in the non-institutional investor category at 274.38 times.
  • Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 235.88 times, while the retail segment was booked 137.96 times.
  • The total issue value is ₹179.39 crore, with shares priced between ₹230 and ₹243.
  • Founded in 1979, Mamata Machinery specializes in manufacturing machines for packaging and flexible materials.
“GMP signals a potential listing price of around ₹503, indicating a 107% premium.”

The strong subscription indicates high investor interest and a favorable market condition that could lead to significant gains post-listing.
newTitle: Mamata Machinery IPO Day 3 Updates: Strong Subscription and Positive GMP Signals Multibagger Listing

title: ITC buys stake in this PENNY STOCK ahead of ITC Hotels demerger record date - ET Now
summary:
ITC Acquires Stake in Penny Stock Ahead of Hotels Demerger

Updated Dec 23, 2024 | Source: ET NOW News

ITC Limited has acquired stakes in a penny stock as the record date for the demerger of its hotels business approaches.

  • ITC has acquired a 0.53% stake in HLV Limited, a penny stock trading on BSE and NSE.
  • HLV Limited's shares closed at Rs 18.30 per share on December 23, down 2.09% from the previous close.
  • The stock delivered a negative return of 34% over the past year but has yielded 209% return over the past five years.
  • ITC also bought a 2.44% equity stake in EIH Limited, operator of luxury hotels, including The Leela Mumbai.
  • The demerger record date for ITC Hotels is January 6, 2025, with the demerger coming into effect on January 1, 2025.
  • One share of ITC Hotels will be issued for every 10 shares held by eligible ITC shareholders.
  • ITC shares closed at Rs 474.25 on December 23, 2024, up 2.07% from the previous close.
“Jefferies has set a target price for ITC Ltd at Rs 550 per share.”

In conclusion, ITC's strategic acquisitions in the hospitality sector appear poised to enhance its growth trajectory, especially with the impending demerger.
newTitle: ITC Acquires Stake in Penny Stock Ahead of Hotels Demerger

Markets stage sharp recovery after five days of fall; Sensex climbs 500 points - Upstox
summary:
Markets Stage Sharp Recovery After Five Days of Fall; Sensex Climbs 500 Points

Published on: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

Equity benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty rebounded sharply on Monday after five days of steep decline amid value buying at lower levels and a rally in global markets.

Key Points:

  • The 30-share BSE benchmark Sensex jumped 498.58 points or 0.64% to settle at 78,540.17.
  • The NSE Nifty surged 165.95 points or 0.70% to 23,753.45.
  • Blue-chip stocks like ITC, HDFC Bank, and Reliance Industries contributed significantly to the recovery.
  • Asian markets showed mixed results while Wall Street ended higher on Friday.
  • In the previous week, the BSE benchmark tanked over 4,091 points or 4.98%.
“Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) offloaded equities worth ₹3,597.82 crore on Friday.”

This recovery signifies a potential stabilization in the market after recent falls, buoyed by positive global cues and selective buying.
newTitle: Markets Stage Sharp Recovery After Five Days of Decline

Adani Group expands aviation reach with ₹400 crore acquisition of Air Works Group - The Economic Times
Adani Group expands aviation reach with ₹400 crore acquisition of Air Works group - The Economic Times
summary:
Adani Group Expands Aviation Reach with ₹400 Crore Acquisition of Air Works Group

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ET Times

The Adani Group announced its acquisition of Air Works, India’s largest private aviation maintenance firm, for an enterprise value of ₹400 crore, enhancing its position in the aviation sector.

  • Adani Defence Systems & Technologies Ltd acquired an 85.8% stake in Air Works.
  • Air Works operates in 35 cities with over 1,300 professionals, providing extensive MRO services.
  • The acquisition aims to strengthen capabilities in both civil and defense aviation MRO services.
  • Air Works supports major defense aircraft for the Indian Navy and Air Force.
  • It aligns with the government’s Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative to boost domestic capabilities.
“This acquisition aligns with our vision to create an integrated aviation services ecosystem that strengthens India's aviation infrastructure.” - Jeet Adani

This acquisition represents a significant step for Adani Group in becoming a key player in India's aviation and defense sectors.
newTitle: Adani Group Expands Aviation Reach with ₹400 Crore Acquisition of Air Works Group

title: 2 New Rs 9 Lakh Cars Confirmed? - MotorOctane
summary:
Tata Motors to Launch Facelifted Tiago and Tigor Models Ahead of Bharat Mobility Show

Publication Date: November 2024   |   Source: MotorOctane

Tata Motors is set to unveil facelifted versions of the Tiago and Tigor as part of their strategy to regain market share lost to competitors. The debut is expected at the upcoming Bharat Mobility Show.

  • Tata Motors confirmed updates for Tiago and Tigor to counter declining sales.
  • The new models will feature cosmetic changes and additional tech features.
  • New generation models are anticipated to arrive around 2026-2027.
  • Powertrain updates include a 1.2-litre petrol engine option with a CNG variant.
  • Exclusive unveilings of Tata’s upcoming SUV lineup are expected at the Bharat Mobility Show.
"To regain market share, Tata Motors is working on a cosmetic update of both cars – ahead of much-required generational updates."

This initiative by Tata Motors not only aims to boost sales but also to enhance their competitive edge in the market.
newTitle: Tata Motors to Launch Facelifted Tiago and Tigor Models Ahead of Bharat Mobility Show

title: Kia Syros Offers These Premium Features In Its Base-spec HTK Variant - CarDekho
summary:
Kia Syros Gets These Premium Features From Its Base HTK Variant: Flush Door Handles, 12.3-inch Touchscreen, 6 Airbags, TPMS And More

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros, recently revealed, stands out in the sub-4m SUV segment by offering a host of premium features right from its base HTK variant.

  • Features include flush-type door handles and a 12.3-inch touchscreen.
  • Interior amenities feature a dual-tone cabin, semi-leatherette upholstery, and various comfort items.
  • Safety features comprise 6 airbags, a rearview camera, and a tyre-pressure monitoring system.
  • The HTK variant is powered by a 1-litre turbo-petrol engine, producing 120 PS.
  • Expected launch is in January 2025, with prices starting around Rs 9 lakh.
"The Syros features a lot of standard safety features, making it a competitively loaded offering in its segment."

Overall, the Kia Syros is shaping up to be a strong player in the compact SUV market with its premium offerings at a competitive price point.
newTitle: Kia Syros Introduces Premium Features in Base HTK Variant

Elon Musk Makes ‘Overstaffed’ Fed Target in Quest for Efficiency | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Elon Musk Makes ‘Overstaffed’ Fed Target in Quest for Efficiency

Publication Date: January 2024

Source: Bloomberg

Elon Musk has targeted the Federal Reserve, describing it as 'absurdly overstaffed' in a recent social media post. This criticism comes as he prepares to lead a new agency aimed at increasing government efficiency.

  • Musk claims the Federal Reserve employs too many staff compared to similar institutions.
  • Approximately 24,000 people worked at the Federal Reserve last year.
  • Musk is set to lead the Department of Government Efficiency, which aims for significant spending cuts.
  • Trump has previously criticized the Federal Reserve and its chair, Jerome Powell.
“I have thousands of hard-working people — economists, jurists, computer scientists — and I can assure you that they work super hard every day, not just once a month.” - Christine Lagarde

This commentary on the Federal Reserve aligns with Trump's earlier criticisms and highlights an ongoing debate about government efficiency.
newTitle: Elon Musk Critiques Federal Reserve Staffing in Push for Government Efficiency

title: Google doesn't want to sell Chrome and Android, proposes swapping Google bloat for other bloat - Android Authority
summary:
Google Proposes Alternative to DOJ's Demand for Chrome and Android Changes

Date: Recently
Source: Android Authority

The US Department of Justice has called for significant changes to Google's Chrome and Android, pressuring the tech giant to address its search monopoly. Google, in response, has offered proposed remedies aimed at providing more flexibility without completely overhauling its services.

  • The DOJ wants Google to sell Chrome and make significant changes to Android to address its search monopoly.
  • Google is proposing alternative remedies that offer more flexibility to browser and device makers.
  • Remedies proposed include more flexibility in setting the default search engine and decoupling other Google apps from being preloaded alongside Search or Chrome.
Google's proposal aims to give browser companies and device makers more control without compromising user privacy.

In conclusion, Google's suggested changes may mitigate the DOJ's concerns while still allowing the company to maintain its core offerings, potentially leading to a more competitive market.
newTitle: Google Proposes Alternative to DOJ's Demand for Chrome and Android Changes

BIG Merger Alert! Honda, Nissan Set To Form World’s Third-Largest Automaker - Times Now
summary:
BIG Merger Alert! Honda, Nissan Set To Form World’s Third-Largest Automaker

Date: March 15, 2024 | Source: New Delhi

The merger between Honda and Nissan represents a significant shift in the automotive industry, focused on electrification and addressing competition from Tesla and Chinese electric vehicle manufacturers.

  • Honda and Nissan signed a memorandum of understanding to merge and become the third largest automaker globally.
  • Mitsubishi Motors is also joining the merger discussions.
  • The new entity is valued at over $50 billion.
  • Together, they plan to produce approximately 8 million vehicles annually.
  • The merger aims to enhance collaboration on electric vehicle components and autonomous driving technology.
"The merger discussions represent a collective effort to adapt to a rapidly evolving market," said a spokesperson from Honda.

This merger could reshape competition in the global automotive market, particularly against established leaders like Toyota and Volkswagen.
newTitle: Honda and Nissan to Merge, Creating the World's Third-Largest Automaker

title: Middle East share of India's November oil imports at 9-month high; Russia down - The Economic Times
summary:
India's November Oil Imports: Middle East Share at 9-Month High

Publication Date: November 2023

Source: ET

India's November crude imports marked a significant increase in Middle Eastern oil, reaching a 9-month high, while reliance on Russian oil saw a notable decline.

  • India's oil imports from the Middle East rose to 2.28 million barrels per day (bpd), accounting for 48% of total imports.
  • Russian oil imports fell to 1.52 million bpd, making up 32% of overall intake, a 13% decrease from October.
  • The overall oil imports increased by 2.5% from October, totaling about 4.7 million bpd.
  • OPEC oil's share in India's crude intake elevated to 53%, the highest in 8 months.
“Russian continued to be the top oil supplier to India followed by Iraq and Saudi Arabia.”

This shift illustrates India's changing dynamics in oil procurement amidst sanctions and global market fluctuations.
newTitle: India's November Oil Imports: Middle East at Highest Share in 9 Months

title: Transrail Lighting IPO subscribed 23.12 times so far on Day 3, retail portion booked 15x; check GMP - CNBCTV18
summary:
Transrail Lighting IPO Overwhelmingly Subscribed 88.80 Times on Final Day

Publication Date: December 23
Source: NSE

Transrail Lighting's IPO experienced a significant subscription on the final day of bidding, with participation from retail and non-institutional investors driving the demand.

The IPO received 88.80 times more bids than shares available, indicating strong market interest.

  • The issue attracted bids for 1,124.43 crore shares against 1.39 crore shares offered.
  • Retail Individual Investors (RIIs) subscribed 22.07 times, while non-institutional investors subscribed 76.41 times.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) portion was subscribed 201.06 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) is approximately ₹180, about 42% above the issue price.
  • The price band for the IPO is set between ₹410-432 per share.
“The order book stood at ₹10,213 crore, with 64% international orders ensuring healthy revenue visibility.”

Overall, Transrail Lighting's IPO is poised for a successful listing with strong investor interest and significant backing from anchor investors.
newTitle: Transrail Lighting IPO Overwhelmingly Subscribed 88.80 Times on Final Day

title: Honda and Nissan officially agree to talk merger; eye sales of 30 tn yen via potential deal - The Economic Times
Nissan, Honda, and Mitsubishi Motors sign MOU on collaborative considerations - Honda Global
summary:
Nissan, Honda, and Mitsubishi Motors Sign MOU for Collaborative Integration

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., Honda Motor Co., Ltd., and Mitsubishi Motors Corporation have signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to explore Mitsubishi's involvement in a business integration focused on synergies in the automotive sector.

  • The MOU aims to establish a joint holding company for integration between Nissan and Honda.
  • Mitsubishi Motors intends to conclude its participation decision by the end of January 2025.
  • Nissan's CEO, Makoto Uchida, expressed hopes for delivering greater value through this integration.
  • Honda's CEO, Toshihiro Mibe, mentioned the potential for significant social changes through this collaborative effort.
  • Mitsubishi's CEO, Takao Kato, emphasized the need for cooperation to maximize synergy effects.
“In an era of change in the automotive industry, the study between Nissan and Honda about a business integration will accelerate synergy maximization effects.” – Takao Kato

This initiative reflects the ongoing transformative changes in the automotive industry and aims to leverage combined resources for future advancements in mobility.
newTitle: Nissan, Honda, and Mitsubishi Motors Sign MOU for Collaborative Integration

title: ​7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations - Times Now
summary:
7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024, Source: Times Now Digital

Working along the lines of Atmanirbhar Bharat, India is witnessing the growth of electric mobility with the introduction to electric vehicles, and less dependence on fuel. Here are 7 Indian states/UTs with the highest EV public charging stations, contributing to its growth.

  • Karnataka: 5,765 EV charging stations
  • Maharashtra: 3,728 EV charging stations
  • Delhi: 1,941 EV charging stations
  • Uttar Pradesh: 1,989 EV charging stations
  • Tamil Nadu: 1,413 EV charging stations
  • Kerala: 1,212 EV charging stations
  • Rajasthan: 1,129 EV charging stations
“Karnataka has set the benchmark with 5,765 public EV stations in India, recording the highest number of charging stations in the country.”

This boost in EV infrastructure is pivotal for India's move towards sustainable transportation and reduced carbon emissions.
newTitle: 7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations

title: Intellect Design Arena, Suven Pharma, India Cements, Zomato, Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy, ITC: Check top buzzing stocks of the day - Upstox
summary:
Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: India Cements, Zomato, ITC and More

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Stock Market News

Domestic stocks were trading in the green in the afternoon deals on December 23, with a notable uptick in several stocks.

  • India Cements: Shares surged up to 11% after CCI approved the acquisition proposal by UltraTech Cement.
  • Zomato: Shares dropped 3% after making its debut on the SENSEX, replacing JSW Steel.
  • Metal Stocks: Increased trading observed in multiple steel manufacturers due to a government probe into imports.
  • TeamLease Services: Trading 2% lower amidst new acquisitions.
  • Siemens India: Shares fell nearly 3% due to lowered order expectations.
  • Insurance Stocks: Experienced declines after GST Council deferred decisions affecting tax rates.
  • Niva Bupa: Positive outlook sees shares rising over 2%.
  • Intellect Design Arena: Trading over 12% higher amid a significant increase in trade volume.
  • Suven Pharmaceuticals: Stock down 6% following acquisition announcements.
  • ITC: Shares higher over 2% as the company finalizes its hotel business demerger.
  • Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy: Trading over 7% higher after receiving a significant order in Gujarat.

The market showed a mixture of highs and lows, reflecting various underlying economic signals and company-specific news.
newTitle: Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: India Cements, Zomato, ITC and More
